alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 29 at 3:24AM EDT until September 29 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Melbourne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Orange County in east central Florida... Northwestern Osceola County in east central Florida... West Central Seminole County in east central Florida... * Until 630 AM EDT. * At 324 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected, with locally higher amounts possible, in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Apopka, Altamonte Springs, Ocoee, Winter Garden, Windermere, Bay Lake, Oak Ridge, Pine Hills, Celebration, Lockhart, Intercession City, Four Corners, Oakland, Bay Hill, Doctor Phillips, and Horizon West. This includes the following streams and drainages... Bonnet Creek, Wekiva River, Reedy Creek and Shingle Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
